author: jgm
content: Just been having a read through this, and the store requirements are pretty large.  Rather than each beacon node hold its own copy of the data, would there be any appetite in having an option to use an external data store accessed through a simple API?  This would allow for sharing the storage between trusted nodes, or even handing it off to external services (which I know isn't ideal, but adding another 500GB to storage requirements could result in further loss of solo stakers).

author: terence0083
content: We also can reduce the duration and/or reduce the target/max size. I personally think one month is too long. 2 weeks or even 9.6 days (2048 epochs) still seem reasonable bound. L2 challenge is one week

author: bridge-bot
content:
<dannyryan> Note, that doc claims 2MB but the economics of a 1/2 (target/max) will result in an average of 1MB over a long period. So that number can be halfed

Additionally, I'm not convinced 1/2 is realistic with current networking so we either need more networking complexity or lower tuned value (value could be lower until more advanced networking in subsequent upgrade)
So maybe another 50% there

And agreed on month being the upper bound of what has been considered. 2 weeks seems sufficient for any use case we are aware of. And some argue even shorter
